answers.answer: OMG praying for you. Hope your blood pressure goes back to normal.

Prayers for you and your baby!! Omg I've been having horrible headaches too that don't go away even with Tylenol, I should really go get checked then. Hope everything turns out okay , relax and stay positive.

Just keep praying and trust....i know is hard to be relaxed but your baby needs you so strong.... too many babies born at 26 or 27 weeks and are healthy doctors can do a lot in these days so if u are 32 weeks im sure your angel gonna be perfect is better take him out than stay inside a vet harm.....trust honey ur blesing is on the way..

Im so sorry to hear thisI will keep you in my prayers and your little one God is a miracle maker and dont lose faith bcus he can make so many miracles happen sending all prayers your way and stay strong❤
Please keep us posted. Prayers your way.
Thanks a lot moms. We are actually doing a little better. Thanks for the prayers. They were truly appreciated.

Hope you doing well!! Sending prayers your way))I had the same situation but at 28 weeks, was diagnosed with severe preeclampsia and had to have a c section. My little girl just turned 1 this month and is doing really well. They do miracles for preemie babies now, so at 32 weeks, worst case, your son will be ok. Try to stay calm, that's the most to can do for your baby now.In pregnant with #2 now (19 weeks) and just keeping my fingers crossed ill make it to full term.

question: As of today I'm am 32 weeks pregnant. I came to the hospital complaining of severe migraine headaches. As I found out my blood pressure was 160/84. I was admitted to the L& D where my blood pressure keep going up. Then climb back down. Then right back up. The Dr. Told me if it doesn't get under control they'll do an emergency c section. I'm scared my baby isn't full term. I'm only 32 weeks.
title: Pray for me & my son
